name: Artemis Search
headline: A search technology that actually finds what youâre looking for.
description:
Artemis Search is a vector database search with a twist. We use special-purpose deep-learning models instead of using textual / semantic similarity to evaluate how good a search result is.

This enables us to actually reason how well search results match the intent of the search query, eliminating the problems that come from evaluating search results on how much they look like the search query.
tags: industry:artificial-intelligence; industry:machine-learning; industry:saas; industry:b2b; industry:search; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Austin McCoy, Founder
founders.description: Austin is a Caltech CS graduate with an emphasis in applied mathematics and finance. Austin has an academic background developing and publishing computer graphics technology and machine learning models at Caltech's Aerospace Robotics and Control (ARCL) laboratory. Austin also has experience launching and selling several small technology businesses ($100k - $1M ARR) centered around developing and selling B2B and B2C software products.

founders.name: Manvir Singh, Founder
founders.description: Manvir is a self-taught software engineer who specializes in building robust and intuitive technology accessible to clients from all backgrounds. He has coordinated with his co-founder, Austin, on previous ventures and looks forward to bringing his experience to bear with Artemis.

generated_description:
Artemis Search is shaking things up in the world of search technology. Founded in 2021 and a proud member of Y Combinator’s Batch S22, this San Francisco-based startup has a mission that’s refreshingly straightforward: to create a search technology that actually finds what you’re looking for.

While most search engines rely heavily on textual or semantic similarity to rank results, Artemis Search goes a step further. It employs special-purpose deep-learning models designed to evaluate how well search results align with the intent behind your queries. This innovative approach means that Artemis can not only return results that look similar to what you asked for but actually make sense in the context of your intent.

Currently, the company operates with a small but mighty team of three, led by Group Partner Dalton Caldwell. Artemis is tagged in the bustling sectors of artificial intelligence, machine learning, SaaS, B2B, and, of course, search. They are currently in beta and are focused on developing an AI-powered prospecting tool that combs the internet to identify ideal customers for businesses.

If you're curious to see what Artemis Search is all about, you can check out their website at [search-artemis.com](https://search-artemis.com/). Whether you're a business looking for smarter search solutions or someone interested in cutting-edge AI technologies, Artemis is a company to keep on your radar. They’re tackling one of the most persistent problems in tech — making search actually work. The future of search could be a lot brighter thanks to them.
